verses.verse: A Song, a Psalm of Asaph. O God <S%H430><s%>, keep not thou silence <S%H8252><s%>: Hold not thy peace <S%H2790><s%>, and be not still <S%H8252><s%>, O God <S%H410><s%>.
For <S%H341><s%>, lo, thine enemies make a tumult <S%H1993><s%>; And they that hate <S%H8130><s%> thee have lifted up <S%H5375><s%> the head <S%H7218><s%>.
Thy take crafty <S%H6191><s%> counsel <S%H5475><s%> against thy people <S%H5971><s%>, And consult <S%H3289><s%> together against thy hidden ones <S%H6845><s%>.

They have said <S%H559><s%>, Come <S%H3212><s%>, and let us cut them off <S%H3582><s%> from being a nation <S%H1471><s%>; That the name <S%H8034><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> may be no more in remembrance <S%H2142><s%>.
For they have consulted <S%H3289><s%> together <S%H3162><s%> with one consent <S%H3820><s%>; Against thee do they make <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%>:
The tents <S%H168><s%> of Edom <S%H123><s%> and the Ishmaelites <S%H3459><s%>; Moab <S%H4124><s%>, and the Hagarenes <S%H1905><s%>;
Gebal <S%H1381><s%>, and Ammon <S%H5983><s%>, and Amalek <S%H6002><s%>; Philistia <S%H6429><s%> with the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Tyre <S%H6865><s%>:
Assyria <S%H804><s%> also is joined <S%H3867><s%> with them <S%H2220><s%>; They have helped the children <S%H1121><s%> of Lot <S%H3876><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>
Do <S%H6213><s%> thou unto them as unto Midian <S%H4080><s%>, As to Sisera <S%H5516><s%>, as to Jabin <S%H2985><s%>, at the river <S%H5158><s%> Kishon <S%H7028><s%>;
Who perished <S%H8045><s%> at Endor <S%H5874><s%>, Who became as dung <S%H1828><s%> for the earth <S%H127><s%>.
Make <S%H7896><s%> their nobles <S%H5081><s%> like Oreb <S%H6159><s%> and Zeeb <S%H2062><s%>; Yea <S%H5257><s%>, all their princes like Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%>;
Who said <S%H559><s%>, Let us take to ourselves in possession <S%H3423><s%> The habitations <S%H4999><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>.
O my God <S%H430><s%>, make <S%H7896><s%> them like the whirling <S%H1534><s%> dust <S%H7179><s%>; As stubble before <S%H6440><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%>.
As the fire <S%H784><s%> that burneth <S%H1197><s%> the forest <S%H3293><s%>, And as the flame <S%H3852><s%> that setteth <S%H3857><s%> the mountains <S%H2022><s%> on fire <S%H3857><s%>,
So pursue <S%H7291><s%> them with thy tempest <S%H5591><s%>, And terrify <S%H926><s%> them with thy storm <S%H5492><s%>.
Fill <S%H4390><s%> their faces <S%H6440><s%> with confusion <S%H7036><s%>, That they may seek <S%H1245><s%> thy name <S%H8034><s%>, O Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>.
Let them be put to shame <S%H954><s%> and dismayed <S%H926><s%> for ever <S%H5703><s%>; Yea <S%H2659><s%>, let them be confounded and perish <S%H6><s%>;
That they may know <S%H3045><s%> that thou alone <S%H8034><s%>, whose name is Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, Art the Most High <S%H5945><s%> over all the earth <S%H776><s%>.
